{{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa del Rey | year = 1914 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = 4 | defending champions = | champions = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | runner-up = [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] | matches = 5 | goals = 23 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1913 Copa del Rey|1913]] | nextseason = [[1915 Copa del Rey|1915]] }} The '''Copa del Rey 1914''' was the 12nd edition of the [[Copa del Rey]], the [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Association football|football]] cup. The competition started on March 29, 1914 and concluded on May 10, 1914 with the Final, held at the [[Estadio de Amute]] in [[Irun]], in which [[Athletic Bilbao]] lifted the trophy for the 5th time ever with a 2â1 victory over [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a de Barcelona]]. The [[Royal Spanish Football Federation]] took complete control of the cup tournament and decided that the clubs of the existing regional championship would qualify for the national cup championship; no free entry would be permitted anymore. Apart from some exception, the elimination rounds were played in two matches (home and away) from this season onwards. ==Teams== * '''North Region''': [[Athletic Bilbao]] * '''Center Region''': [[Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola|Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica]] * '''South Region''': [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla BalompiÃ©]]The champions of the South Region did not inscribe for the tournament (actually, Sevilla BalompiÃ© was going to participate as champion of "Seville Cup", a tournament played by Seville clubs, as South Region Championship was not created until 1915). *'''[[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]]''': [[Real Vigo Sporting|Real Vigo SC]] * '''[[Catalonia]]''': [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] ==Semifinals== ===First leg=== {{footballbox | date = March 29, 1914 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 11–0 | team2 = [[Real Vigo Sporting|Real Vigo SC]] | stadium = [[San MamÃ©s Stadium]], [[Bilbao]] }} {{footballbox | date = April 26, 1914 | team1 = [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] | score = 1–0 | team2 = [[Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola|Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica]] | stadium = [[Barcelona]] }} ===Second leg=== {{footballbox | date = April 5, 1914 | team2 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 3–3 | team1 = [[Real Vigo Sporting|Real Vigo SC]] | stadium = [[Vigo]] }} ''Athletic Bilbao won 14–3 on aggregate'' {{footballbox | date = May 3, 1914 | team2 = [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] | score = 1–1 | team1 = [[Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola|Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica]] | stadium = [[San MamÃ©s Stadium]], [[Bilbao]] }} ''EspaÃ±a FC won 2–1 on aggregate'' ==Final== {{main|1914 Copa del Rey Final}} {{footballbox |date = May 10, 1914 |time = 16:30 |team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] |score = 2–1 |team2 = [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] |goals1 = Zuazo {{goal|20||29}} |goals2 = {{goal|88}} Villena |stadium = [[Estadio de Amute|Amute]], [[Irun]] |referee = Mr. Rowland}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; margin: 0 auto;" |- ![[Copa del Rey]] 1914 winners |- | '''[[Athletic Bilbao]]'''
